org.powermock.core.invocationcontrol.method
Interface MethodInvocationControl

All Known Implementing Classes:
MethodInvocationControlImpl
public interface MethodInvocationControl

The purpose of an invocation control is to determine whether a certain method is mocked or not. This is determined by pairing up an InvocationHandler (that is associated with an entire object) and the Methods for this object that should be mocked.

Author:
Johan Haleby

Method Summary
 org.easymock.internal.MockInvocationHandler getInvocationHandler()
          Get the invocation handler.
 Set<Method> getMockedMethods()
          Get the methods that are mocked for this invocation control.
 boolean isMocked(Method method)
          Determine whether a certain method is mocked by this Invocation Control.
 

Method Detail

getMockedMethods

Set<Method> getMockedMethods()
Get the methods that are mocked for this invocation control. If the returned Set is empty, all methods are considered to be mocked.

Returns:
A Set of methods that are mocked. The set can never be null.

getInvocationHandler

org.easymock.internal.MockInvocationHandler getInvocationHandler()
Get the invocation handler.

Returns:
The invocation handler.

isMocked

boolean isMocked(Method method)
Determine whether a certain method is mocked by this Invocation Control.

Parameters:
method - The method that should be checked.
Returns:
true if the method is mocked, false otherwise.
